content_parts.content:
Previously, our practice involved resetting customer-side mappings when introducing mapping changes at each upgrade. This has raised concerns about potential loss of customer-made changes. In our commitment to a more user-friendly experience and a seamless upgrade process, we have developed a solution that preserves customer modifications while facilitating smooth upgrades. This involved updating the standard mapping, categorizing each field as either editable or non-editable.

Starting now, the mapping object grid has evolved:

  • Removing the description, required, data type, and read-only fields on the Intacct side from the default display. Despite this change, these fields remain accessible through column settings.
  • Introducing the "Editable" column which indicates which fields have shifted from editable to non-editable.
  • Renaming the property option to default property, which displays the standard value if the field is updated by the customer

It's important to note that with recent changes, the standard mapping has transitioned from allowing modification of any field to only permitting edits to fields identified as editable in this release.

content_parts.title: MRP enhancements - MRP Request and results page merge, Notifications and Results delete option

content_parts.content:
The following enhancements have been implemented:

  1. The user can now create an MRP calculation request directly from the MRP calculation page, and see the results from the same page. The MRP calculation request menu item has been removed and the MRP calculation result menu item has been renamed MRP calculation. 
  2. The user will now be notified when the MRP calculation has completed. The user will be able to access the results from the notification.
  3. The user now has the ability to delete calculations either individually or in bulk.

content_parts.title: Intacct Integration performance enhancement on transactions

content_parts.content:
Experience improved performance with our latest update, as the integration of finance document sent to Sage Intacct is now processed asynchronously.

To monitor the status of journal entry integration, simply navigate to the Integration page located under Administration > Communication in the menu. This page now provides visibility into the finance documents currently undergoing integration processing and introduces the capability to perform bulk synchronization.

Enhancements extend to the top filter, allowing users to selectively filter either finance or reference data integration for a more streamlined experience.

Association of landed costs to purchase receipts

The new landed cost functionality of SDMO enables you to accurately calculate and manage the total cost associated with acquiring inventory items or goods. It goes beyond the basic purchase cost of the items and includes additional costs that are incurred during the procurement and transportation process.

Landed cost service option

To leverage the Landed cost functionality of SDMO you must activate the Landed cost service option in Administration > Application configuration > Service option

Landed cost items

In order to allocate landed costs to a purchase receipt, an essential prerequisite is to set up the landed cost applicable in your procurement process on the item page of SDMO. For items of type 'Landed cost' respective allocation rules, e.g. by quantity, by amount, by volume, or by weight, can be defined and an allocation unit can be associated.

Association of landed costs to purchase receipts

With the current release, SDMO supports the allocation of landed cost items to the corresponding purchase receipt and therefore allows you a better understanding of total purchased goods costs.

When you enter a purchase invoice for landed costs, e.g. an invoice for transportation from a carrier, on the purchase invoice page, you can allocate the landed cost item to one or several associated purchase receipts. SDMO will then create the respective landed cost accrual and purchase price variance journal entries.

Posting class

New account types for landed cost accruals and landed cost expenses have been added to the detailed item posting class.
